item.title: ECTHR submissions
item.description: Before I publish more, I first need to redact more information from what was submitted to the European Court of Human Rights since the Court’s records pertaining to this case, V.L.C. v. France (50552/22) have been sealed. (1) General Introduction (2) Dear Honorable Judges of the European Court of Human Rights, (3) I request the permission to file my application, including the request for interim measures and any subsequent legal proceedings, in the English language. This request is predicated on specific considerations pertinent to the case at hand.

item.title: Application no. 50552/22
item.description: In 2022, I submitted two requests to the European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR). Case V.L.C. v. France (50552/22). One of the requests was denied and the other request, request for anonymity, was approved. In 2023, I submitted additional requests to the European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR). You can read redacted versions of what I explained to the ECtHR on December 15, 2023, and on December 20, 2023.
